analytical tool designed to describe the operation of the economy of a country or a region

degree of variation of life forms
process of converting a device, process, or society to the use of electric power

entry.desc: ways to remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere

entry.desc: organization independent of any government, usually created to aid those in need

entry.name: Intergovernmental Process on Climate Change
entry.desc: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) is an intergovernmental body of the United Nations responsible for advancing knowledge on human-induced climate change.

entry.name: Nationally Determined Contributions
entry.desc: non-binding national plans highlighting climate actions

international agreement from 12 December 2015 within the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) dealing with greenhouse gas emissions mitigation, adaptation and finance starting in the year 2020

entry.desc: core platform of the United Nations for monitoring and review of Agenda 2030.

situation requiring choice of balance between desirable but incompatible features; a compromise

land regeneration method

entry.name: electric vehicle
entry.desc: vehicle propelled by one or more electric motors and possibly also by an internal combustion engine, such as a train locomotive, a personal car, a freight truck, a bus, a tram, a trolleybus, an aircraft, a boat, a motorcycle or a bike

Theory U is a change management method and the title of a book by Otto Scharmer.

entry.name: electrostatic discharge
entry.desc: sudden flow of electricity between two electrically charged objects caused by contact, an electrical short, or dielectric breakdown

entry.name: Water-sensitive urban design
entry.desc: (WSUD) is a land planning and engineering design approach which integrates the urban water cycle, including stormwater, groundwater, and wastewater management and water supply, into urban design to minimise environmental degradation and improve aesthetic and recreational appeal.
process of creating a digital representation of a document or object
